docs.title: About Me
docs.text: My mission is to research the fundamental challenges of robotics, Control, Optimization, AI, and computer vision that will benefit all of humanity. I am dedicated to advancing the frontiers of technology to create autonomous machines that can navigate all by themselves using only onboard sensors and computations.

docs.title: My Research Area
docs.text:
• Robotics: Pioneering advancements in autonomous systems.
  • Control Systems: Innovating control strategies for precision and reliability.
  • Optimization Techniques: Solving complex problems efficiently.
  • Artificial Intelligence: Advancing AI for enhanced machine decision-making.
  • Computer Vision: Developing machines that perceive and understand the world.

docs.title: Important Links
docs.text:
Google Scholar: Google Scholar

SCOPUS: SCOPUS

ORCID ID: ORCID ID

Clarivate Web of Science: Webofscience

docs.title: My Robot Fleet
docs.text:
Discover our fleet of cutting-edge robotic platforms:

  • Scout Mini and Scout Hunter Ground Robots: Versatile ground robots for terrestrial navigation and decision-making.
  • TurtleBot4 and TurtleBot3: Educational and research robots bridging theory and practice.
  • Delivery Robots: Autonomous solutions for last-mile delivery and logistics.
  • Crazyflie 2.1 & Autonomous Drones: Aerial robotics for indoor and outdoor surveillance, disaster response, and beyond.

docs.title: Vision
docs.text: My vision is a future where autonomous machines play a pivotal role in addressing complex challenges and improving the quality of life for people across the globe. I prioritize ethical considerations in AI and robotics, ensuring our technology is developed and deployed responsibly and for the betterment of all.

docs.title: Collaborations
docs.text: I foster collaboration and knowledge-sharing among experts, academia, and industry partners to accelerate progress and ensure the widespread adoption of our innovations.

docs.title: Scout_Mini
docs.text: Welcome to the Scout Mini documentation. This guide provides an overview of Scout Mini and links to tutorials and documentation available in the Scout ROS GitHub Repository.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Overview
  • Hardware Overview
  • Getting Started
  • Tutorials
  • Tutorial 1: Basic Setup
  • Tutorial 2: Teleoperation
  • Tutorial 3: Mapping
  • Tutorial 4: Navigation
  • Troubleshooting
  • Additional Resources

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Scout Mini is a versatile and compact robotic platform designed for various applications. It is integrated with ROS (Robot Operating System) for easy development and customization. For detailed information about Scout Mini, visit the Scout ROS GitHub Repository.

docs.title: Hardware Overview
docs.text: To understand the hardware components of Scout Mini, please refer to the hardware documentation.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
To get started with Scout Mini, follow these general steps:

  1. Clone the Scout ROS repository from GitHub.
  2. Install the necessary dependencies as mentioned in the repository's README.
  3. Explore the documentation and tutorials for specific tasks.

docs.title: Tutorials
docs.text: Explore the following tutorials to learn more about Scout Mini:

docs.title: Tutorial 1: Basic Setup
docs.text: Learn how to set up and configure Scout Mini by following the Basic Setup tutorial.

docs.title: Tutorial 2: Teleoperation
docs.text: Discover how to teleoperate Scout Mini using ROS by following the Teleoperation tutorial.

docs.title: Tutorial 3: Mapping
docs.text: Learn how to create maps with Scout Mini using ROS in the Mapping tutorial.

docs.title: Tutorial 4: Navigation
docs.text: Master autonomous navigation with Scout Mini in the Navigation tutorial.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: If you encounter issues while working with Scout Mini, you can refer to the troubleshooting section of the documentation for solutions to common problems.

docs.title: Additional Resources
docs.text:
For more in-depth information and advanced usage of Scout Mini, explore the Scout ROS GitHub Repository and its associated documentation.

Happy exploring and developing with Scout Mini, and feel free to reach out if you have any questions or need assistance!

docs.title: Crazyflie2.1
docs.text: Welcome to the Crazyflie 2.1 drone documentation. This guide will help you get started with the Crazyflie 2.1 drone and explore its various features and capabilities.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Overview
  • Hardware Overview
  • Getting Started
  • Tutorials
  • Tutorial 1: Basic Setup
  • Tutorial 2: First Flight
  • Tutorial 3: Advanced Maneuvers
  • Tutorial 4: Sensor Integration
  • Troubleshooting
  • Additional Resources

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The Crazyflie 2.1 is a versatile and compact quadcopter designed for experimentation and research. This documentation will guide you through the setup, operation, and advanced usage of your Crazyflie 2.1.

docs.title: Hardware Overview
docs.text: Before diving into tutorials, let's familiarize ourselves with the Crazyflie 2.1's hardware components. Refer to the official hardware documentation for detailed information.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
To get started with the Crazyflie 2.1 drone, follow these general steps:

  1. Assemble the hardware components as per the assembly instructions.
  2. Install the Crazyflie client software on your computer.
  3. Connect and configure your Crazyflie 2.1 drone.

docs.title: Tutorials
docs.text: Explore the following tutorials to learn more about using the Crazyflie 2.1:

docs.title: Tutorial 1: Basic Setup
docs.text: Learn how to set up and configure your Crazyflie 2.1 for the first time by following the Basic Setup tutorial.

docs.title: Tutorial 2: First Flight
docs.text: Discover how to perform your first flight with the Crazyflie 2.1 in the First Flight tutorial.

docs.title: Tutorial 3: Advanced Maneuvers
docs.text: Take your drone flying skills to the next level with the Advanced Maneuvers tutorial.

docs.title: Tutorial 4: Sensor Integration
docs.text: Explore how to integrate and use additional sensors with your Crazyflie 2.1 in the Sensor Integration tutorial.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: If you encounter issues while working with the Crazyflie 2.1, you can refer to the troubleshooting section of the documentation for solutions to common problems.

docs.title: Additional Resources
docs.text:
For more in-depth information and advanced usage of the Crazyflie 2.1 drone, explore the Bitcraze documentation and its associated resources.

Happy flying with your Crazyflie 2.1, and feel free to reach out if you have any questions or need assistance!

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: In this tutorial, we'll walk you through the process of building an autonomous drone using the PX4 and Ardupilot platforms. Autonomous drones have a wide range of applications, from aerial photography to search and rescue missions. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a fully functional autonomous drone capable of executing pre-planned missions.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before getting started, ensure you have the following prerequisites:

  • Hardware Requirements:
  • Drone frame and components
  • Flight controller
  • GPS module
  • Motors and propellers
  • Battery and charger
  • Radio transmitter and receiver
  • Computer for development

  • USB cable, connectors, and tools

  • Software Requirements:

  • PX4 Firmware
  • Ardupilot Firmware
  • Mission Planner or QGroundControl

docs.title: Setting Up the Drone Hardware
docs.text:
• Assemble the drone hardware according to the manufacturer's instructions.
  • Pay careful attention to safety precautions during assembly.

docs.title: PX4
docs.text:
• Install PX4 firmware on the flight controller using QGroundControl or manually.
  • Verify the installation.

docs.title: Ardupilot
docs.text:
• Install Ardupilot firmware on the flight controller using Mission Planner or manually.
  • Ensure successful installation.

docs.title: PX4
docs.text:
• Configure the flight controller settings using QGroundControl.
  • Set up essential parameters for autonomous flight.
  • Define flight modes and their settings.

docs.title: Ardupilot
docs.text:
• Configure the flight controller settings through Mission Planner.
  • Define flight modes and configure safety checks.
  • Adjust important parameters for autonomous missions.

docs.title: Programming the Autonomous Behavior
docs.text:
• Discuss the importance of mission planning and flight paths.
  • Explain how to plan missions using Mission Planner or QGroundControl.
  • Include examples of mission scripts and commands.

docs.title: Testing and Calibration
docs.text:
• Emphasize the importance of calibration for sensors and compass.
  • Detail the calibration process for both PX4 and Ardupilot.

docs.title: Autonomous Flight Testing
docs.text:
• Provide instructions for conducting autonomous flight tests.
  • Explain how to monitor and analyze flight data.
  • Include safety guidelines for testing.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• List common issues and errors during autonomous flight.
  • Provide solutions and troubleshooting steps.

docs.title: Additional Resources
docs.text:
• PX4 Documentation
  • Ardupilot Documentation
  • ROS (Robot Operating System) Documentation

docs.title: F1Tenth
docs.text: Welcome to the F1Tenth Autonomous Racing Platform! In this tutorial series, we'll explore the world of autonomous racing and guide you through the process of getting started with F1Tenth. This platform is designed to help you learn about autonomous driving in a fun and challenging environment.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Autonomous racing is an exciting field that combines the thrill of racing with cutting-edge technology. The F1Tenth platform allows you to explore this field and gain hands-on experience in autonomous driving.

docs.title: About F1Tenth
docs.text: The F1Tenth platform provides a miniature, open-source, and low-cost autonomous racing car that you can use to develop and test autonomous algorithms. It's a powerful tool for learning and research in the field of autonomous vehicles.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Before you dive into the tutorials, make sure you have the necessary hardware and software components. Visit the F1Tenth website to find detailed information on what you need to get started.

docs.title: Tutorial 1: Setting Up F1Tenth
docs.text: Get started by setting up your F1Tenth racing car and the required software environment. This tutorial will guide you through the initial setup steps.

docs.title: Tutorial 2: Autonomous Racing Basics
docs.text: Learn the fundamentals of autonomous racing, including basic controls and navigation. Get your F1Tenth car moving autonomously.

docs.title: Tutorial 3: Sensor Integration
docs.text: Explore the integration of sensors into your racing car to improve perception and decision-making. Understand how to use lidar, cameras, and other sensors effectively.

docs.title: Tutorial 4: Perception and Control
docs.text: Dive into perception algorithms and control strategies that enable your car to interpret sensor data and make autonomous driving decisions.

docs.title: Tutorial 5: Advanced Topics
docs.text: Advance your knowledge with topics like path planning, trajectory generation, and more. Take your autonomous racing skills to the next level.

docs.title: Additional Resources
docs.text: For additional materials, documentation, and community support, please visit the F1Tenth website.

docs.title: TurtleBot4
docs.text: Welcome to the TurtleBot4 User Manual. This guide will help you get started with TurtleBot4 and its various features.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Introduction
  • Hardware Overview
  • Getting Started
  • Installing ROS
  • Tutorial 1: Basic Teleoperation
  • Tutorial 2: Mapping
  • Tutorial 3: Navigation
  • Troubleshooting
  • Additional Resources

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: TurtleBot4 is a versatile and powerful robotic platform designed for a wide range of applications. This user manual will guide you through setting up and using your TurtleBot4 effectively.

docs.title: Hardware Overview
docs.text: Before diving into tutorials, let's familiarize ourselves with TurtleBot4's hardware components. Refer to the official documentation for detailed information.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Follow these steps to set up your TurtleBot4:

  1. Assemble the hardware components as per the assembly instructions.
  2. Power up your TurtleBot4 and connect it to your computer.
  3. Install the necessary software, including ROS (Robot Operating System).

docs.title: Installing ROS
docs.text: To start using TurtleBot4 with ROS, you need to install ROS on your computer. Follow the ROS installation guide for detailed instructions.

docs.title: Tutorial 1: Basic Teleoperation
docs.text: Learn how to teleoperate your TurtleBot4 by following the Basic Teleoperation tutorial. This tutorial will introduce you to controlling the robot using a keyboard or a joystick.

docs.title: Tutorial 2: Mapping
docs.text: Discover how to create maps with TurtleBot4 using the Mapping tutorial. Mapping is essential for autonomous navigation.

docs.title: Tutorial 3: Navigation
docs.text: In the Navigation tutorial, you'll learn how to make your TurtleBot4 autonomously navigate within an environment.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: Encountering issues? Refer to our troubleshooting guide for solutions to common problems.

docs.title: Additional Resources
docs.text:
For more in-depth information and advanced usage of TurtleBot4, explore our additional resources.

Have fun exploring the capabilities of your TurtleBot4, and don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions or need assistance!

Official TurtleBot Website

docs.title: Our Vision for this project
docs.text: Our mission is to revolutionize the way goods are delivered within urban environments. We're committed to creating a fleet of autonomous delivery robots that can navigate even the world's most densely populated metropolises. Our vision is to run cost-effective, on-demand robot delivery services that make urban sidewalks safer and more efficient.

docs.title: Our Delivery Robot
docs.text: Our delivery robot represents the cutting-edge in autonomous robotics technology. It's designed to safely and efficiently transport packages and goods, reducing traffic congestion, emissions, and delivery times.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Autonomous Navigation: Our robots navigate autonomously, avoiding obstacles and ensuring timely deliveries.
  • Efficient Delivery: With advanced route optimization, we ensure packages are delivered quickly and securely.
  • Safety First: Safety sensors and protocols are in place to ensure safe interactions with pedestrians and vehicles.
  • Environmentally Friendly: Reducing emissions and traffic congestion, our robots contribute to a greener urban environment.

docs.title: Mission and Goals
docs.text:
Our mission is to automate urban sidewalks by running cost-effective, on-demand robot delivery services. We aim to:

  1. Enhance Efficiency: Streamline urban deliveries to reduce delivery times and improve resource allocation.
  2. Reduce Emissions: Minimize the environmental impact of urban logistics by utilizing eco-friendly delivery methods.
  3. Promote Safety: Prioritize pedestrian safety and efficient sidewalk sharing in densely populated areas.
  4. Innovate Continuously: Stay at the forefront of autonomous robotics and adapt to the evolving urban landscape.

docs.title: Tutorials
docs.text:
Explore our tutorials to learn more about our delivery robot and how it can benefit your business or community:

  1. Getting Started with Our Delivery Robot
  2. Autonomous Navigation and Safety
  3. Efficient Route Planning
  4. Using Our Delivery Robot for Your Business

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Learn how to get started with our delivery robot and integrate it into your operations.

docs.title: Autonomous Navigation and Safety
docs.text: Discover the technology behind the autonomous navigation of our delivery robot and the safety measures in place.

docs.title: Efficient Route Planning
docs.text: Optimize your deliveries with our route planning tutorial, ensuring timely and cost-effective deliveries.

docs.title: Using Our Delivery Robot for Your Business
docs.text: Explore how businesses can leverage our delivery robot for improved logistics and customer satisfaction.

docs.title: Self Driving Car
docs.text: Welcome to the Self-Driving Car Project! In this tutorial series, we'll explore the fascinating world of autonomous vehicles and guide you through the process of building your own self-driving car. This project aims to help you understand the core concepts and technologies behind autonomous driving.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Self-driving cars represent the future of transportation, promising safer and more efficient roads. This project will provide you with the knowledge and skills needed to embark on your self-driving car journey.

docs.title: Course Overview
docs.text:
Our self-driving car course is designed to cover the following key areas:

  • Fundamentals: Understand the core principles of autonomous driving.
  • Sensors: Explore various sensors and their integration into self-driving systems.
  • Perception: Learn how self-driving cars perceive and understand their environment.
  • Control: Dive into control systems for autonomous vehicles.
  • Decision Making: Explore algorithms and techniques for decision-making in complex traffic scenarios.

docs.title: Tutorial 1: Basics of Self-Driving Cars
docs.text: Start your journey with an introduction to self-driving car technology and the fundamental concepts that underlie autonomous vehicles.

docs.title: Tutorial 2: Sensor Integration
docs.text: Learn about the various sensors used in self-driving cars and how to integrate them into your vehicle for data collection and perception.

docs.title: Tutorial 3: Perception and Mapping
docs.text: Dive into the world of perception and mapping, where you'll understand how self-driving cars interpret their surroundings and create maps for navigation.

docs.title: Tutorial 4: Control Systems
docs.text: Explore control systems that allow self-driving cars to execute precise maneuvers and follow planned paths safely.

docs.title: Tutorial 5: Decision Making
docs.text: Delve into the decision-making processes of autonomous vehicles and discover how they navigate complex traffic scenarios.
